other_tests.findings: The progressive nature of glaucoma necessitated immediate surgical intervention. A valved glaucoma drainage device (GDD) was implanted in the right eye under sub-tenon's anesthesia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-surgery, the IOP was controlled with a regimen of topical antibiotic, steroid, brinzolamide, and timolol. The refractory nature of the glaucoma resolved after the child was delivered.

other_tests.findings: The left eye was operated on due to complications from previous glaucoma management.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Managed with brinzolamide/timolol fixed combination and bimatoprost due to bleb scarring.

other_tests.findings: Ocular assessment of children revealed no condition in the 5-year-old daughter and the presence of the autosomal dominant condition in her newborn son.
